query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Poi fummo dentro al soglio de la porta 2 che ’l mal amor de l’anime disusa, 3 perché fa parer dritta la via torta,
query.error: **English:** 1 Then we were inside the threshold of the gate 2 that evil love of the lost souls 3 makes seem straight the crooked way,
query.result: 1 Tataḥ asmākam praviṣṭāḥ āsīt dvārasya śīrṣaṇe 2 yat pāpaḥ premāṇām ātmānām vināśitānām, 3 yataḥ vakrayām mārgaṃ darśayati ṛjuḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 sonando la senti’ esser richiusa; 5 e s’io avesse li occhi vòlti ad essa, 6 qual fora stata al fallo degna scusa?
query.error: **English:** 4 hearing it being shut behind us; 5 and if I had turned my eyes to it, 6 what excuse would have been worthy for the fault?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 Noi salavam per una pietra fessa, 8 che si moveva e d’una e d’altra parte, 9 sì come l’onda che fugge e s’appressa.
query.error: **English:** 7 We were climbing a rock that was split, 8 which moved this way and that, 9 like a wave that flees and approaches.
query.result: 7 Vayam ārurohamhaḥ ekaṃ śilākhaṇḍam viṣamam, 8 yat calati sma idam ca tad ca pakṣam prati, 9 yathā tarangaḥ yaḥ palāyati ca āgacchati ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 «Qui si conviene usare un poco d’arte», 11 cominciò ’l duca mio, «in accostarsi 12 or quinci, or quindi al lato che si parte».
query.error: **English:** 10 "Here it is necessary to use a little skill," 11 my leader began, "in approaching 12 now on this side, now on that, the side that leads away."
query.result: 10 "Iha kalāṃ prayoktavyam alpikām," 11 ārabhata mama netā, "upagame 12 iha vāmapakṣe, iha vā dakṣiṇe, yaḥ pakṣaḥ viyujyate."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 E questo fece i nostri passi scarsi, 14 tanto che pria lo scemo de la luna 15 rigiunse al letto suo per ricorcarsi,
query.error: **English:** 13 And this made our steps slow, 14 so much that before the moon's wane 15 returned to its bed to set again,
query.result: 13 Etad eva akārṣīt asmākam padānām manda-gatitvam, 14 Yāvat candrasya kṣayaḥ punaḥ 15 Svakiyam śayanam prāpya astadrayitum,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 che noi fossimo fuor di quella cruna; 17 ma quando fummo liberi e aperti 18 sù dove il monte in dietro si rauna,
query.error: **English:** 16 we were not out of that ravine; 17 but when we were free and in the open, 18 up where the mountain draws back,
query.result: 16 Na vayam tasmāt khaṇḍāt bahiḥ āsiṣma, 17 Yada tu vayam svatantrāḥ abhayāś ca abhūma, 18 Ūrdhvam yatra parvataḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ samāvartate,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 ïo stancato e amendue incerti 20 di nostra via, restammo in su un piano 21 solingo più che strade per diserti.
query.error: **English:** 19 I, weary, and both uncertain 20 of our way, remained on a plain 21 more solitary than roads through deserts.
query.result: 19 Aham śrāntaḥ ubhau ca asamsayaḥ 20 Asmākam mārgasya, sthitavān asmi eke samatale 21 Ekake deśe adhika-niḥsvasne mārgeṣu iva mṛga-patheṣu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Da la sua sponda, ove confina il vano, 23 al piè de l’alta ripa che pur sale, 24 misurrebbe in tre volte un corpo umano;
query.error: **English:** 22 From its edge, where the void ends, 23 to the foot of the high bank that rises steeply, 24 a human body would measure it in three steps;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 e quanto l’occhio mio potea trar d’ale, 26 or dal sinistro e or dal destro fianco, 27 questa cornice mi parea cotale.
query.error: **English:** 25 and as far as my eye could stretch its wings, 26 now to the left and now to the right flank, 27 this cornice seemed to me to be such.
query.result: 25 Yāvat ca mama cakṣuḥ pakṣau prasārayitum śaknute sma, 26 Idānīm vāma-pakṣāt, idānīm dakṣiṇa-pakṣāt, 27 Mama ayam kaṇṭhaḥ tādṛśaḥ abhūt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Là sù non eran mossi i piè nostri anco, 29 quand’ io conobbi quella ripa intorno 30 che dritto di salita aveva manco,
query.error: **English:** 28 There our feet had not yet moved, 29 when I recognized that bank all around, 30 which had a slope that led up on the left,
query.result: 28 Tatrāsmākaṃ pādāḥ api na cālitaḥ āsīt, 29 yadā aham ajānāṃ tām tīram asmin paryāye, 30 yasya samarohaṇam āsīt vāma-diśi,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 esser di marmo candido e addorno 32 d’intagli sì, che non pur Policleto, 33 ma la natura lì avrebbe scorno.
query.error: **English:** 31 to be of white marble and adorned 32 with such carvings that not only Polyclitus, 33 but Nature herself would have been put to shame there.
query.result: 31 abhūt śukla-śilāmayaṃ ca śobhitaṃ ca, 32 tādṛśaiḥ śilpakaiḥ yathā na kevalam Polyclitus, 33 api tu prakṛtiḥ api tatra lajjām āpnoti sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 L’angel che venne in terra col decreto 35 de la molt’ anni lagrimata pace, 36 ch’aperse il ciel del suo lungo divieto,
query.error: **English:** 34 The angel who came to earth with the decree 35 of the peace wept for many years, 36 who opened heaven from its long prohibition,
query.result: 34 Sa deva-dūtaḥ yaḥ pṛthivīm āgataḥ āsīt śāsana-patra-saha, 35 Dirghāṇāṃ varṣāṇāṃ ruditāyāḥ śānti-śāsanasya, 36 Yaḥ svargam tadīyāc cirātana-niṣedhāt vimuktam cakāra,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 dinanzi a noi pareva sì verace 38 quivi intagliato in un atto soave, 39 che non sembiava imagine che tace.
query.error: **English:** 37 appeared so true before us 38 there, carved in a gentle act, 39 that it did not seem like an image that is silent.
query.result: 37 Asmābhiḥ purastāt tathā satyaḥ adṛśyata, 38 Tatrāṅkitaḥ madhura-ākāreṇa, 39 Yathā na mūka-mūrtiḥ iva pratibhāti sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 e avea in atto impressa esta favella 44 ‘Ecce ancilla Deï’, propriamente 45 come figura in cera si suggella.
query.error: **English:** 43 and she had these words imprinted in her attitude 44 ‘Ecce ancilla Dei’, exactly 45 as a figure is stamped in wax.
query.result: 43 tasyāś ca bhāve ayam śabdaḥ ābhāsitaḥ āsīt 44 ‘Ecce ancilla Dei’, yathāvat 45 yathā mṛttikāyāṃ mūrtiḥ mudritā bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 «Non tener pur ad un loco la mente», 47 disse ’l dolce maestro, che m’avea 48 da quella parte onde ’l cuore ha la gente.
query.error: **English:** 46 "Do not keep your mind fixed on just one thing," 47 said the gentle master, who was on that side 48 where people have their heart.
query.result: 46 "Na kevalamekena viṣayena manaḥ sthāpaya," 47 uvāca madhuraḥ guruḥ, yaḥ āsīt 48 tasmin diśi yasmin hṛdayam janānāṃ bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Per ch’i’ mi mossi col viso, e vedea 50 di retro da Maria, da quella costa 51 onde m’era colui che mi movea,
query.error: **English:** 49 Because of which I moved with my face turned, and saw 50 behind me, on that side from which came 51 he who was moving me,
query.result: 49 Yasmāt aham mukhena calitasya, apaśyam 50 paścāt mama, tataḥ pakṣāt 51 yataḥ āgataḥ āsīt saḥ yaḥ māṃ calayati sma,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 un’altra storia ne la roccia imposta; 53 per ch’io varcai Virgilio, e fe’mi presso, 54 acciò che fosse a li occhi miei disposta.
query.error: **English:** 52 another story depicted on the rock; 53 because of which I passed Virgil and drew near, 54 so that it would be displayed to my eyes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 Era intagliato lì nel marmo stesso 56 lo carro e ’ buoi, traendo l’arca santa, 57 per che si teme officio non commesso.
query.error: **English:** 55 There was carved there in the very marble 56 the cart and the oxen, drawing the holy ark, 57 for which one fears an office not entrusted.
query.result: 55 Tatrābhūtśilāyāṃ nirmamitaḥ 56 Rathaḥ gāvaśca, ṛṣabhaḥ ṛṣabhaḥ, ṛṣabhaḥ, 57 Yataḥ bhayam anādeṣṭa-karmaṇaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Dinanzi parea gente; e tutta quanta, 59 partita in sette cori, a’ due mie’ sensi 60 faceva dir l’un ‘No’, l’altro ‘Sì, canta’.
query.error: **English:** 58 Before me appeared people; and all of them, 59 divided into seven choirs, made 60 one of my senses say ‘No’, the other ‘Yes, sing’.
query.result: 58 Purastāt prādurbabhūvuḥ janāḥ; sarve ca te, 59 sapta gaṇeṣu vibhaktāḥ, dve me indriye 60 ekam ‘na’ iti, anyat ‘hi, gāyatām’ iti ācakṣate sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Similemente al fummo de li ’ncensi 62 che v’era imaginato, li occhi e ’l naso 63 e al sì e al no discordi fensi.
query.error: **English:** 61 Similarly to the smoke of incense 62 that was imagined there, the eyes and the nose 63 disagreed with each other on yes and no.
query.result: 61 Tathā dhūpānāṃ dhūmena 62 Yat tatra kalpitam āsīt, cakṣuṣī ca ghrāṇam ca 63 Hā nāstiti vipratipannābhavatām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Lì precedeva al benedetto vaso, 65 trescando alzato, l’umile salmista, 66 e più e men che re era in quel caso.
query.error: **English:** 64 There, preceding the blessed vessel, 65 dancing and leaping, was the humble psalmist, 66 and in that circumstance he was more and less than a king.
query.result: 64 Tatra pūjyapātrasya puras tataḥ, 65 nṛtyan udvīkṣya, nīcaḥ stutipāṭhakaḥ, 66 adhikaḥ alpaś ca rājñāṃ tadābhūt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Di contra, effigïata ad una vista 68 d’un gran palazzo, Micòl ammirava 69 sì come donna dispettosa e trista.
query.error: **English:** 67 Opposite, depicted in a scene, 68 of a grand palace, Michal was looking on, 69 as a disdainful and sorrowful woman.
query.result: 67 Pratyakṣam, ekatra dṛśye ālikhitā, 68 ekasya bṛhatasya prāsādasya, Mikāl avalokayati sma, 69 yathā tyaktakārodhikā duḥkhitā ca strī.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 I’ mossi i piè del loco dov’ io stava, 71 per avvisar da presso un’altra istoria, 72 che di dietro a Micòl mi biancheggiava.
query.error: **English:** 70 I moved my feet from the place where I was standing, 71 to examine up close another story, 72 which was gleaming white behind Michal.
query.result: 70 Aham caranau sthānāt yasminn aham āsīt calitavān, 71 समीpe 'nyām āख्याyikām jñātum, 72 yā Micōlasya paścāt me śuklā abhavat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Quiv’ era storïata l’alta gloria 74 del roman principato, il cui valore 75 mosse Gregorio a la sua gran vittoria;
query.error: **English:** 73 Here was recounted the great glory 74 of the Roman prince, whose valor 75 moved Gregory to his great victory;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 i’ dico di Traiano imperadore; 77 e una vedovella li era al freno, 78 di lagrime atteggiata e di dolore.
query.error: **English:** 76 I speak of the emperor Trajan; 77 and a widow was at his bridle, 78 adorned with tears and grief.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Intorno a lui parea calcato e pieno 80 di cavalieri, e l’aguglie ne l’oro 81 sovr’ essi in vista al vento si movieno.
query.error: **English:** 79 Around him seemed to be pressed and full 80 of horsemen, and the eagles in the gold 81 above them moved in the wind.
query.result: 79 Asya paritaḥ samākulaḥ pūrṇaścaiva 80 aśvarūpaiḥ, suvarṇe ca śikhariṇaḥ 81 upari teṣām vāyau calantaḥ dṛṣṭāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 La miserella intra tutti costoro 83 pareva dir: «Segnor, fammi vendetta 84 di mio figliuol ch’è morto, ond’ io m’accoro»;
query.error: **English:** 82 The wretched woman among all these 83 seemed to say: "Lord, avenge me 84 for my son who is dead, for which I grieve";

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 ed elli a lei rispondere: «Or aspetta 86 tanto ch’i’ torni»; e quella: «Segnor mio», 87 come persona in cui dolor s’affretta,
query.error: **English:** 85 and he to her replies: "Now wait 86 until I return"; and she: "My lord," 87 like a person in whom grief hastens,
query.result: 85 sa ca tasyāḥ prati-vacanaṃ dadāti: "Adya prati-īkṣasva 86 yāvat aham āgacchāmi"; sā ca: "Bhagavan mama", 87 yathā vyaktiḥ yasmin duḥkham āturaṃ bhavati,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 «se tu non torni?»; ed ei: «Chi fia dov’ io, 89 la ti farà»; ed ella: «L’altrui bene 90 a te che fia, se ’l tuo metti in oblio?»;
query.error: **English:** 88 "if you do not return?" And he: "Whoever will be where I am, 89 will do it for you"; and she: "What good will the good of others be to you, 90 if you forget your own?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 ond’ elli: «Or ti conforta; ch’ei convene 92 ch’i’ solva il mio dovere anzi ch’i’ mova: 93 giustizia vuole e pietà mi ritene».
query.error: **English:** 91 To which he: "Now take comfort; for it is fitting 92 that I fulfill my duty before I move: 93 justice demands it and pity holds me back".
query.result: 91 tataḥ sa: "Idānīm tvam samāsvāsayasva; yataḥ ucitam 92 mama svakṛtyam pūrayitum asmāt sthānāt calanāt pūrvam: 93 nyāyasya icchā asti, dayā ca mama pratibandhakam asti".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Colui che mai non vide cosa nova 95 produsse esto visibile parlare, 96 novello a noi perché qui non si trova.
query.error: **English:** 94 He who never saw anything new 95 produced this visible speech, 96 new to us because it is not found here.
query.result: 94 Yaḥ kaścid api na kadācid api adṛṣṭapūrvam vastu, 95 sa eva idam dṛśyam vākyam ajījanat, 96 asmābhiḥ navaṃ yataḥ tatra na labhyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Mentr’ io mi dilettava di guardare 98 l’imagini di tante umilitadi, 99 e per lo fabbro loro a veder care,
query.error: **English:** 97 While I was delighting myself in beholding 98 the images of so many humbled spirits, 99 and in seeing them precious because of their Maker,
query.result: 97 Yāvad aham ātmānaṃ ramayāmi paśyan 98 aneka-vinītāḥ mūrtayaḥ, 99 tāsāṃ ca kartṛ-nimittena pūjyāḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 «Ecco di qua, ma fanno i passi radi», 101 mormorava il poeta, «molte genti: 102 questi ne ’nvïeranno a li alti gradi».
query.error: **English:** 100 “Behold, over there, but they make their steps rare,” 101 murmured the poet, “many people: 102 these will direct us to the high grades.”
query.result: 100 “Paśya atra, kimtu viramāḥ padāni kurvanti,” 101 mṛdu-śabdena kavir avocat, “bahu-janāḥ: 102 ete asmān nayiṣyanti uttama-pāda-deśān.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Li occhi miei, ch’a mirare eran contenti 104 per veder novitadi ond’ e’ son vaghi, 105 volgendosi ver’ lui non furon lenti.
query.error: **English:** 103 My eyes, which were content to gaze 104 to see the new things for which they are eager, 105 turning towards him were not slow.
query.result: 103 Mama netrāṇi, yāni prekṣaṇe santuṣṭāni āsīt 104 nautanīyāni paśyāya yebhyaḥ tāni āśliṣṭāni, 105 tasya abhimukham āvartante sma na vilambitāni.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Non vo’ però, lettor, che tu ti smaghi 107 di buon proponimento per udire 108 come Dio vuol che ’l debito si paghi.
query.error: **English:** 106 I do not want you, reader, to be dismayed 107 by good intentions when you hear 108 how God wants the debt to be paid.
query.result: 106 Na tvāṃ, vācaka, icchāmi viṣādaṃ prāptuṃ 107 śubhānāṃ saṅkalpānāṃ śravaṇāt 108 yathā devaḥ icchati ṛṇaṃ dātavyam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Non attender la forma del martìre: 110 pensa la succession; pensa ch’al peggio 111 oltre la gran sentenza non può ire.
query.error: **English:** 109 Do not consider the form of martyrdom: 110 think of the succession; think that for the worst 111 beyond the great judgment it cannot go.
query.result: 109 Mṛtyuroḥ svarūpaṃ mā cintaya: 110 uttaraṃ cintaya; cintaya yatkṛṣṇatamaṃ 111 mahāvakyasya param naiva yāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Io cominciai: «Maestro, quel ch’io veggio 113 muovere a noi, non mi sembian persone, 114 e non so che, sì nel veder vaneggio».
query.error: **English:** 112 I began: "Master, what I see 113 moving towards us does not seem to be people, 114 and I do not know what it is, so I am deluded in seeing it."
query.result: 112 Ahaṃ prārabdhaḥ: "He gurū, yat kiṃ paśyāmi 113 āgacchat amoghaṃ asmābhiḥ, na mānuṣāḥ iva te, 114 na jānāmi kim, tathāpi darśane mohayāmi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Ed elli a me: «La grave condizione 116 di lor tormento a terra li rannicchia, 117 sì che ’ miei occhi pria n’ebber tencione.
query.error: **English:** 115 And he to me: "The grievous condition 116 of their torment bends them down to earth, 117 so that my eyes had contention with them beforehand.
query.result: 115 Sa ca mama: "Durāvasthā 116 Teṣāṃ kleśasya bhūmau tāṃsaṃkocati, 117 Yathā mama netrāṇi pūrvam eva taiḥ vivadam cakratuḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Ma guarda fiso là, e disviticchia 119 col viso quel che vien sotto a quei sassi: 120 già scorger puoi come ciascun si picchia».
query.error: **English:** 118 But look closely there, and with your face 119 uncover what comes beneath those rocks: 120 now you can see how each one beats himself."
query.result: 118 Api tu dṛṣṭvā tatraiva niścitaṃ, 119 mukhena ācchāditaṃ yat kiñcid asti śilānāṃ adhastāt, 120 adhunā paśyasi yathā ekaikaḥ ātmānaṃ tāḍayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 O superbi cristian, miseri lassi, 122 che, de la vista de la mente infermi, 123 fidanza avete ne’ retrosi passi,
query.error: **English:** 121 O proud Christians, wretched and weary, 122 who, sick in the sight of your mind, 123 have trust in backward steps,
query.result: 121 He durbhagāḥ durbalāśca kṛṣṭīyāḥ, 122 ye manaḥcakṣuḥpīḍitāḥ, 123 pṛṣṭhagāmiṣu padavīṣu viśvāsam kurutha,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 non v’accorgete voi che noi siam vermi 125 nati a formar l’angelica farfalla, 126 che vola a la giustizia sanza schermi?
query.error: **English:** 124 do you not realize that we are worms, 125 born to form the angelic butterfly, 126 that flies to justice without barriers?
query.result: 124 na jānītha kim asmākam kīṭāḥ, 125 utpadyante kiṃ svarūpeṇa pitṛdevatānāṃ, 126 ye niṣpratibandhakāḥ satyārthe viharanti?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Di che l’animo vostro in alto galla, 128 poi siete quasi antomata in difetto, 129 sì come vermo in cui formazion falla?
query.error: **English:** 127 Why does your spirit soar so high, 128 when you are almost like defective automatons, 129 like a worm in which formation fails?
query.result: 127 Kimartham utkarṣeṇa manaḥ samvardhayatha, 128 tataḥ kva cit svayam eva vihvalāḥ bhavata, 129 yathā kīṭe rūpasya viparītatvam bhavati?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Come per sostentar solaio o tetto, 131 per mensola talvolta una figura 132 si vede giugner le ginocchia al petto,
query.error: **English:** 130 As to support a ceiling or a roof, 131 sometimes a figure is seen as a bracket, 132 joining its knees to its chest,
query.result: 130 Yathā gṛhasya vā chādane dhāraṇe vā, 131 kadācit ādhāreṇa mūrtiḥ, 132 janūnī urasā samyojayantī dṛśyate,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 la qual fa del non ver vera rancura 134 nascere ’n chi la vede; così fatti 135 vid’ io color, quando puosi ben cura.
query.error: **English:** 133 which causes real pain in the beholder 134 from the sight of something unnatural; thus 135 I saw them, when I paid close attention.
query.result: 133 yā mithyāsatī satyarūpiṇī vedanāṃ janayati, 134 paśyati yaḥ saḥ; evam 135 tadvatān aham adṛkṣam, yadā samyak dhyānam adadhām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Vero è che più e meno eran contratti 137 secondo ch’avien più e meno a dosso; 138 e qual più pazïenza avea ne li atti,
query.error: **English:** 136 It is true that they were more or less bent over, 137 according to how much or little they had on their backs; 138 and whoever had more patience in his actions,
query.result: 136 Satyamasti yatteṣāṃ śarīrāṇi ādau śithilāni āsann alpam vā bahu vā bhāraṃ bibhratāṃ, 137 ye ca karmaṇi adhikaṃ kṣamāṃ bibhrati sma, 138 rudanta iva vaktuṃ prāyeṇa dṛśyante sma: ‘Adhikaṃ na śaknomi’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 piangendo parea dicer: ‘Più non posso’.
query.error: **English:** 139 weeping she seemed to say: 'I can no more'.
query.result: 139 rudatīva manyate vaktum: 'Adhikaṃ na śaknomi'.
